utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know who’s got to be the bravest person in the Marvel Universe? Whoever has to give She-Hulk a bikini wax.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You want to talk brave, how about Captain America’s undocumented Mexican gardener?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s not braver than whoever uses the bathroom after The Thing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: As usual, you’re all wrong. The bravest person in the Marvel Universe is the doctor who gives Wolverine his prostate exam.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How about the guy who gets a prostate exam from Wolverine?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now you just being silly. Wolverine’s never displayed the slightest interest in helping others prevent prostate cancer. Hello. Yes, the elevator’s out of order you’ll have to use the stairs. Of course you can. Pizza dates back to the 16th century, while the first elevator was not installed until 1852. That means that for over 300 years, people carried pizzas up stairs. Be part of that proud tradition.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll go get Penny while that guy spits on our food.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do you think they gave Wolverine an Adamantium prostate?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s a stupid question.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We’re having a conversation about probing the heinies of superheroes. There are no stupid questions.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, um, is Penny here?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: You’re Leonard, right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Damn, it’s good to finally meet you, son.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I think a bit of context here might help.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Leonard. I see you met my dad.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, good. Context.

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Come on in, buddy. Take a load off.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, gee, dad, Leonard can’t stay. He just dropped by to say hello. Thanks for stopping by, sweetie. I’ll see you later. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That was odd.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you sure you have enough comics? You’re going to be monitoring the telescope for 12 hours, and by my estimate, you’ve only selected seven hours of reading material. That’s even factoring in your difficulty in parsing American comic book idioms like Bamf and Snikt.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is that racist? It feels racist.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t be oversensitive. He’s calling you illiterate, not your race.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Good. I don’t need more comics. Howard’s gonna stop by, we’re gonna play intergalactic battleship and Indian Monopoly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t care for novelty editions of Monopoly. I prefer the classics, regular and Klingon.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Actually, Indian Monopoly’s just like regular, except the money’s in Rupees, instead of hotels you build call centers, and when you pick a chance card, you might die of dysentery. Just FYI, that was racist.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’ll never guess what just happened.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You went out in the hallway, stumbled into an interdimensional portal which brought you 5,000 years into the future, where you took advantage of the advanced technology to build a time machine, and now you’re back to bring us all with you to the year 7010 where we are transported to work at the thinkatorium by telepathically controlled flying dolphins?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny kissed me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, who would ever guess that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What… what kind of a kiss?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A big kiss. On the mouth.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Is it possible that she was going for your cheek and you moved and she accidentally got lip? That happens with me and my mom all the time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She introduced me to her father, kissed me and then shut the door in my face.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You think?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. This man is not my father. I’m being held hostage. So I’m going to do something insane in the hopes that you’ll call 911.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny kissing me is not insane. She used to kiss me all the time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Einstein defined insanity as doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results. By that standard, Penny is cuckoo for cocoa puffs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m just saying, it felt like it may have meant something.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ah, this takes me back. Leonard obsessing about Penny. I mean, don’t get me wrong, I love your new stuff, but once in a while it’s nice to hear the hits.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, ooh! Do our babies will be smart and beautiful. That one always makes me laugh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why do I bother talking to you people?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If it’ll make you feel better, we rarely listen.

utterance.speaker: Penny (at door)
utterance.content: Hey, can I talk to you out here for a sec?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m starting to think we’re never going to see that pizza.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So you’re probably wondering what that was all about.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What, uh, the kissing and everything? Nah, women do that to me all the time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, okay. The thing is, I kind of told my father we got back together again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What? Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you’re the first guy he’s ever really approved of, you know? You’re a scientist who went to college and you don’t have a neck tattoo or outstanding warrants or, or a baby.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What kind of guys did you used to go out with?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Just guys. Anyway, when I told him we split up, he was heartbroken, and he kept bugging me, how’s Leonard? why can’t you get back together with Leonard? I bet Leonard never tipped a cow over on himself. So to get him off my back, I told him we worked things out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? How, how’d we manage that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, did you apologize? Did you have to woo me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Get over yourself. I whistled, you came running.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, no, I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, why are you arguing about this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m just saying, if we fake got back together, that’s totally not how it fake happened.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, okay, whatever. Will you please just play along until my dad leaves?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hold on, you actually want me to deceive your father with some sort of sham play acting and kissing? Cause I’m good with that.

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Penny, you out here?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, honey, not in front of my dad.

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: Relax, I’ve seen you do a lot worse with a lot stupider.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: See? He doesn’t mind.

utterance.speaker: Penny’s Dad
utterance.content: So, Leonard, I’m taking your gal out for a steak dinner, you want to join us?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, dad, that’s nice, but Leonard has to work. Right, Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, I do, I have to work. But I’m gonna blow that off to spend the evening with my sweetie and her father, ’cause, you know, just the kind of boyfriend I am.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come here, you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Miss.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How could that be a miss? C-6 was a hit, C-8 was a hit. Part of your starship has to be on C-7.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not if it has a hole in the middle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What kind of spaceship has a hole in the middle?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: A Romulan battle bagel?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Knock-knock.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, great, you made it. Come on in. I invited her.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So where’s the telescope?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s in Hawaii, but Raj controls it from here. He’s hoping to see Epsilon Eridani dim, which would be evidence of a planet orbiting it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So we just sit and stare at the screen, waiting for something to happen?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I did it with you when we rented The Notebook. Yes, Gena Rowlands is a treasure. You’d better open up that bottle of wine or I’m gonna end up with swimmer’s ear.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Excuse me. I can’t be drinking, I’m about to make an important scientific discovery here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What? Galileo did his best work while drinking wine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How do you know that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, he was Italian. It’s a reasonable assumption.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, can you even open your mouth without spewing a cultural stereotype?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I, I’m sorry, Galileo drank diet sprite. Look, you’re my best friend, she’s my girlfriend, you should bond. You know, like you and my mom did.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Your mom creeps the hell out of me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, but she’s stopped calling you slumdog millionaire.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I do appreciate that.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well I’d like to propose a toast. To science and friendship.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hold on. Wait. No, it’s okay, go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, I was working with Penicillin-resistant gonorrhoea in the lab today and I was just trying to remember if I washed my hands.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks for the steak, Wyatt.

utterance.speaker: Penny’s dad (Wyatt)
utterance.content: My pleasure. It’s nice to have dinner with a boyfriend of Penny’s that knows how to use a napkin.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So not funny, dad.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Let me tell you about this one genius she was going out with, this, this fella Donnie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, will you please let it go?

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Donnie was gonna make millions turning farm waste into biofuel and selling it to the government.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A lot of people are doing that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, see?

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Yeah, but all Donnie did was mix pig poop with a little water and pump it into his mom’s Camry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s great. It’s a funny story. Moving on.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: And Donnie was a rocket scientist compared to that boy who wanted to get beer pong into the Olympics. What was his name, sweetheart?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Curtis, and I’m pretty sure he was joking.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: I don’t know. That petition looked real to me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, I think this ends the ex-boyfriend portion of our evening.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Well, I’m just glad you finally found yourself a keeper.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks, Wyatt. I’m a keeper.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Leonard, you want to come in for a nightcap?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, gee, dad, he’d love to, but Leonard has to work in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe I could go in a little late.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no, no, you can’t. Your career is far too important.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Behind every great man is a nagging woman who won’t let him have any fun, am I right, Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t I know it.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Well, good night, son.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good night, Wyatt. Oh, good night, honey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Love you, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, friggety-frak. Not this again.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Three, four, five, pass go, get 2,000 Rupees, Six, seven, whoops. Can’t go any further. There’s a sacred cow in my way.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Bernadette, please tell your boyfriend to cool it with the cow jokes.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It won’t help. Once he finds a joke he likes, he sticks with it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah. Like his haircut material.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, right. Did you get your hair cut?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No. I got them all cut.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Which is still so funny.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And when you go to a Chinese restaurant, he always gets the same fortune in his fortune cookie.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Right. Help, I’m a prisoner in a Chinese fortune cookie factory.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, I think that’s enough about me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He’s right. Let’s make fun of his mother. Howard, come rub my feet! My corns are killing me!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard, help me out of the tub! I’m stuck again!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Coming. Hey, lovebug.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Shut up. You know what I’ve been doing for the last hour?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm, dreamily doodling Mrs. Leonard Hofstadter in a notebook?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Listening to my father go on and on about what a great guy you are.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You got to admit, I am, I’m delightful.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why are you making this so difficult?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not difficult for me. I’m having fun.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you want me to do? You started this. Do you want to go over and tell him we’re broken up?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, then, what do you want?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t you think that’s something you should have figured out before you stomped over here?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Maybe.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, Penny, excellent. I’d like to say I’m very happy that you’re back together, and if I can figure out a way to do so and sound sincere, I will. In the meantime, I’d like to go over some proposed changes to the roommate agreement specifically to address Penny’s annoying personal habits.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God. What personal habits?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I have a list. FYI, overuse of the phrase, oh, my god, is number 12.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, Sheldon, you don’t have to do this because Leonard and I are not…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ba-ba-ba-ba. Are you sure you want to include him in this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Include me in what? Is there a plot afoot? I’ll have no truck with plots.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, you’re right. No, there’s, there’s no plots, no trucks, no feet. So what other annoying habits shall we discuss?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, we don’t discuss anything. Leonard is the signatory to the Roommate Agreement. As such, he bears responsibility for all your infractions and must pay all fines.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fines?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. If Penny’s going to be spending nights here again, you’ll need to set up an escrow account. Sign here.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hello, Hawaii. This is Dr. Koothrappali in Pasadena. I’d like you to reposition the telescope, please. Scarlett Johansson’s house! I’m kidding, Hawaii. Mahalo. Whoo!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It might have been a mistake to open that second bottle of wine.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, live and learn. So, Raj, do you think this planet you’re looking for could have an atmosphere that supports life?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe. If it did, I’d be famous. I’d be on the cover of magazines. And then, instead of living alone in my tiny apartment, I’d have a big mansion.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That sounds great.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It is. If you like wandering around a big, empty house with no one to love you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’d come visit you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, you wouldn’t. You’d be intimidated by my wealth and fame. My only friends would be my genetically engineered monkey butler, and the little people I hired to be my living chess set.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He’s taking a turn to the dark side, isn’t he?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hold on. He could come back.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, what’s the point of everything?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nope. He’s gone.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know it’s been more than a year since I’ve even kissed a girl?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What about that hook-up at Comic-Con you told me about?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, grow up. I was lying. I lie all the time. Nobody wants to kiss me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, you poor, poor thing. Raj, you have to know you’re a wonderful man. There are a lot of girls out there who’ll want to kiss you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You just have to look.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, this was fun.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Oh! I think I got a nibble.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, b-be careful. Give him some line. Okay, now reel him in.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Oh, look at that baby. They’re really biting, huh?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. They do that when you set it on easy.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt (phone rings)
utterance.content: Oh, that’s me. Hello. Oh, hi, sweetie. Yeah, I got up early and didn’t want to wake you, so I went out for coffee and ran into Leonard on the way back. Guess what, we’re fishing. Yeah. Right here on his couch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, baby. I love you! Mwuh, mwuh, mwuh, mwuh, mwuh.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: That’s Leonard says he loves you. What? I see. The whole thing’s bull squirt, huh? Well, that’s very disappointing. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey. There’s been something I’ve been meaning to tell you.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: I can’t believe you would lie to me like that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just for the record, I did not want to be a part of this.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: I’ll get to you in a minute.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No hurry.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: That my own daughter thinks I don’t love her enough to support her no matter what choices she makes, well, that hurts me deeply.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry, daddy…

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Let me finish.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: I thought we were past the days when you would try to pull the wool over my eyes. Telling me the baggie in your underwear drawer is potpourri? And the pee stick in your bathroom is to check for diabetes?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: You’re a grown woman, and I respect your right to make your own decisions, but all I ask is you respect me enough to be honest about them.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re right. Look, from now on, I will tell you the truth.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Thank you. Now, why don’t you go and put some clothes on and we’ll grab a bite to eat before I head for the airport. Now you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Daddy, he had nothing to do…

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Keep walking.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Please, please, please don’t give up on her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: I can’t go back to the skateboard idiots, the white rappers and all those sweaty dumb-asses with their backwards hats.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Gee, I don’t know if it’s in the cards, sir.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Then, stack the deck. Cheat. Lie. I don’t care. I want grandkids before I die, and I want them to grow up in a house without wheels.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll give it a shot.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Thank you. Now I’m going to do something here to help you along.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Just don’t panic. Now, get your sorry, lying ass out of my face and make sure I never see it again!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, the reverse psychology thing. I see. That’s very clever.

utterance.speaker: Wyatt
utterance.content: Don’t yap. Just get out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll friend you on Facebook.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, there you are. Just so you know, I was up all night, but I have finally completed the Penny-specific section of the new roommate agreement.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, well, not necessary. We broke up again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you even think about other people, Leonard? Do you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, how’d it go last night?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, you know. Same old, same old. Looked through a telescope, saw some stars. Big whoop.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? You waited months for time with that telescope. What happened?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why? You writing a book?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m going to propose a hypothesis. Last night, Raj accidentally made contact with an alien civilization and has been ordered by the United States government to keep it a secret.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Nothing happened. Can we please just change the subject?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That sounds rehearsed. We are not alone.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You get to play with Raj’s big telescope last night?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Whoa. Where did that come from?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He never touched my telescope.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Way to go shutting up.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I did shut up. Now you shut up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you. How come you didn’t call me this morning?
